sentences.en: According to their stories, they boycott to battle all the difficulties.
sentences.cn: 根据他们的典故, 他们手挽手心连心克服困难.

sentences.en: As Kerr fled towards the exit, Boycott collared him at the ticket barrier.
sentences.cn: 克尔往出口方向逃窜，博伊科特在验票口逮住了他。

sentences.en: Boycott , a former British soldier, refused to charge lower rents and ejected his tenants.
sentences.cn: 作为原英军士兵的博伊考特, 拒绝收取低地租并且驱逐佃户.

sentences.en: Boycott was the estate agent of the Earl of Erne in County Mayo, Ireland.
sentences.cn: 博伊考特是爱尔兰麦奥县俄内伯爵的房地产经纪人.

sentences.en: North Korea originally declared it would boycott the event because of safety concerns.
sentences.cn: 世界大运将会于周四在韩国的大邱举行.

sentences.en: Rosie Boycott was not involved editorially with Virago.
sentences.cn: 罗西·博伊科特不属于维拉戈出版公司的编辑队伍。

sentences.en: The boycott lasts a year until the Victoria board permitsreturn.
sentences.cn: 这个抗争持续了一年直到维多利亚教育局妥协为止.

sentences.en: They are now trying to organize a boycott .
sentences.cn: 他们正试图组织一场抵制行动。

sentences.en: They are now trying to organize a boycott.
sentences.cn: 他们正试图组织一场抵制行动。

sentences.en: We boycott all products tested on animals.
sentences.cn: 我们抵制所有拿动物做试验的产品。

sentences.en: Well , the boycott isand French didn't really know all the story.
sentences.cn: 多数法国人并不了解这其中的缘由.

trans.tran_en: an act of boycotting something, or the period of time when it is boycotted
to refuse to buy something, use something, or take part in something as a way of protesting
